block.p: Norway's environment minister, TORBJORN BERNTSEN, also has a quick temper, and it showed Monday when he used an insulting scatological expression and then said the British agriculture minister, JOHN GUMMER, was the biggest one "I have ever met in my life."

Mr. Berntsen's remark, made at a political rally and widely reported in Norwegian newspapers, was another chapter in a blistering feud between the two governments: Norway says that acid rain from Britain is ruining the country, while the British are furious with Norway for its planned resumption of commercial whaling despite an international moratorium.

Mr. Berntsen offered no apology for his expression yesterday and certainly extended no dinner invitation so the two could make up.
Mr. Gummer said, "I'm not going to reply to people who use this sort of language."
